If perfection became reincarnated as a game, it would be Portal 2.
I Love GLaDOS!

It's a nice solid puzzle game with countless levels on the workshop which a very nice way to continue the game past the campaign, plus, the create a level tool is very easy to use, the co-op is also fun to do with another person. Overall, a very solid 3D puzzler game that through it's clever workshop and co-op integration, continues to be a relevant game to this day. Also, pretty much anything other than a chromebook can run this game well at some level (any somewhat modern gaming PC will easily max this game out) 9.5/10 I would reccomend this to anyone.
A Master Piece!
역시 포탈! 엄청 재미있어요

BACKGROUND 

Not to good at most puzzle games, but fairly familiar with first person shooters. I originally bought this game on the PS3 for 30, and then re-bought it on Steam for 7.50. At the time of the review, I am replaying the campaign, so that will only be briefly touched on. 

SPECS FOR PLAY THROUGH 

- AMD FX 8350 @ 4.0ghz
- GTX 760 4GB
- 8gb DDR3 @ 668
- 7200 RPM HDD

OVERALL PORT 

It's a PC game. Valve makes PC games. So it's perfect.

PROS 

+ Entertaining campaign
+ HOLY POOP WORKSHOP SUPPORT
+ Beautiful mechanics
+ Feeling of success after each puzzle never fades
+ Learning curve is perfect

CONS 

- Can be a tad time consuming and mentally straining. 
- Certain puzzles seem some what repetitive. With thousands of maps, however, this is un-avoidable.

CONCLUSION

The fact that this game has Workshop support should be enough of a reason to go and pick it up, however, it is on sale quite frequently. I have spent far more than the average person has on this game and have no regrets.
is rly good

Portal 2... How do I describe this... I'll start with this; If you've never played the original Portal, don't worry. Heck, I say skip that. Portal 2 is much better, and even if you think you'll skip any of the plot, here's what happened. Chell killed GladOs. That's it. As for the game, It's really fun and puzzling and you'll LOVE Wheatly. Hands. Down. And as for the community, there are lots of maps to play, and lots of fun for hours on end! There's also Co-Op if you want to play with a friend, where you play as either Orange or Blue, working together to complete the testing courses. That is all.

Ancora una volta 10 punti per Valve con un gioco che, nonostante ignoravo, pensando che non mi avrebbe soddisfatto al 100% e che mi avrebbe fatto buttare via dei soldi, con i succulenti saldi di Steam ho comprato Portal 2, un gioco che unisce perfettamente i puzzle game all'azione dei videogiochi in prima persona, un perfetto mix tra il gameplay e la storia, che rendono i rompicapi coinvolgenti nonostante la complessità e l'ingegnosità di alcuni di essi. Nonostante io non abbia giocato al primo Portal (anche se mi piacerebbe), la storia del gioco e le meccaniche si possono benissimo coprendere, senza troppi spoiler del capitolo precedente.
Consiglio questo gioco a TUTTI, non è un semplice puzzle game, [b]è[/b] il puzzle game per eccellenza!
Play this now!

虽然因为每个人的口味不同，任何游戏都可能会有玩家不喜欢，但总有极个别触动了人心追求乐趣的本质的游戏能够得到所有玩家的交口称赞，传送门2就是这样一款游戏。
无论从剧情、画面、配音、乐趣、多人......等各各方面都挑不出丝毫瑕疵，这样的作品才担当得起“完美”这两个字。

Portal 2 is inovative, refreshing, challenging and downright brilliant. It's a blast to play, and between the puzzles that did my head in so much I needed to restart to get a new viewpoint and the awesome feeling of owning a coop test chamber, there is no other game I could recommend more. If you don't have Portal 2, it's a must have for any gamer. The clever gameplay and the witty characters will keep you entertained, and once you've completed the single player story, jump onto the steam workshop and download more maps others have made! What's more, Portal 2's coop system is amazing, allowing communication through the game in an instant with clear commands on keys for those without a mic to talk to their partner on the other end of the net. I rate Portal 2 a (9/10).
(I know I said there's no other game I would recommend more highly, but that was for this genre).
Thanks valve! Another great game.

P.S. If anyone is unsure of whether to buy Portal 2 or not, I recommend downloading the free "Portal: The First Slice" game from the store.
Всем привет! Вы играли в Portal 2 я тоже, и вот скоро новинка продолжение игры (Portal 2) и это Conversion это круто всем пока!

Never really played Valve's Portal 2 all the way through until this weekend. What a jaw-dropping game! You think you're nearing the end... then a whole new other game starts up (and it's amazing too). The level design and 3D modelling are just astounding. Astounding! And the atmosphere... creaking giant metallic structures and dripping water... Superb music too (heavily Alien/Aliens/Alien3-influenced). The scripting and voice acting for Aperture Science CEO Cave Johnson is also very funny. Stephen Merchant I'm not so sure about, but Portal 2 really is a wonderful game and an incredible achievement. And no shooting involved at all! Just brain power and skill. It'll no doubt drop in price this week in the Steam holiday sale, so if you haven't yet played it: I'd highly recommend it.

This game is a masterpiece. It's story and puzzles are out of the park. If you only buy one game, ever, it should be this.

Story:
This game takes place in a run-down version of the aperture labs seen in the first game. But, unlike it's predecessor, you are helped along by a sphere named wheatley. As you try to escape, you end up waking GLaDoS, the antagonist from the first game, and you are thrown back into full testing. It's now up to you alone to escape.
This game's story is very deep and intricate, with nods to the Borealis in some easter eggs, and even the direct mention of black mesa. It has characters with immensly deep and suprisingly dark backstories, and is a game I contemplate still to this day.

Puzzles:
The puzzles are much more difficult than the first game, and less hand-holding than before. It introduces some nice new testing elements, as well as makes new use of the old ones. The puzzles never end, either, thanks to the "Perpetual Testing Initiative" (Level editor + Custom levels on the workshop). The co-op puzzles double the fun, and difficulty, resulting in a massive need for teamwork. 

Graphics:
The game is suprisingly beautiful, for running on a game engine from the turn of the century. It's lighting and shadows outmatch other popular games, and they don't kill your system. My computer can run this game at medium settings, and my graphics card is an Intel Integrated Graphics HD 4000 (Planning on building a PC soon, using a laptop). It's still a good looking game, and will probably hold up for a while.

Audio:
This game's music is always there, whether ambiently in the background, or boosting your pulse as you run through broken halls, death on your tail. The music is actually availiable free on their website, 3 full albums with all of the music included in the game.

Multiplayer:
This game's co-op is brilliant, with customization of the two robots "Atlas" and "P-Body". Using the ping system to coordinate, you don't even need a microphone to communicate with someone random you meet. It even has a bit of story to the game, with the last level group revealing a large secret. The custom levels recentley updated to allow multiplayer, so this dosen't end for a while.

In conclusion, the game has a ton of nice features, content, and is really worth the $20 USD, if you are a first time player. I'm planning on getting a few more copies when it goes on sale to hand out to my friends that don't already own it, and play through with them. I love this game, and it's what got me back into gaming.

Portal2をプレイするとこのゲームの事しか考えられなくなるなどの重大な障害が残る可能性があります。
研究チームによると、Portal2をプレイしてしまった際の対処法は、
「Portal2をプレイしてはならない」だそうです。
ゲームについては調査中だが、中毒性に富み、
睡眠とはきわめて相性が悪いことがわかっています。

Amazing game. The story, the humor, the puzzles. A great game for all ages.

Hab das Spiel ursprünglich mal auf der PS3 angezockt und mir dann im Sale auf Steam zugelegt.

Das Spiel hat alles was ein gutes Spiel haben muss.
Der Humor ist großartig und das Leveldesign erklärt einem das Spiel von selbst.

Man hätte es sich einfach machen können und lediglich immer neue, schwierigere Level aneinander reihen können, aber nein, das Spiel erzählt darüber hinaus noch eine Story, die unterhaltsam ist.

Auch der Koop-Modus ist schwer zu empfehlen, da er der Story in Sachen Humor und Leveldesign ebenbürtig ist.

Klare Kaufempfehlung für jeden, der gerne knobelt aber kein Bock auf Kreuzworträtsel hat.
Meu jogo favorito sz
Amazing game

Portal 2? Olha, possivelmente o jogo da Valve que mais marcou a minha vida. Chegando mesmo a ganhar do Half-Life 1 e 2.
Ele é considerado como um jogo de Puzzle, mas é muito mais que isso, é um jogo de ação e aventura, comédia, suspense e raciocínio lógico. Com uma historia muito bem detalhada que preenche o espaço do enredo do jogo e uma gameplay divertida e que te faz insistir a jogar mais, possivelmente um jogo que eu tenho orgulho de zerar. Cada personagem tem sua personalidade e voz, menos o personagem principal, que se mantém calado pra manter a atmosfera do jogo. GLaDOS é a deusa das vilãs, ela é incrível e tem muito carisma, e... mesmo sendo um robô, sentimentos. O jogo é realmente difícil  e você vai quebrar a cabeça e uns 2 ou 3 teclados pra zerar ( Hahaha e.e ), se você pensa em compra-lo, saiba que não perdera um centavo com essa obra de arte que é Portal 2. E eu lhe desejo boa sorte.
Minha nota final: 10/10

I strongly considered being contrary and writing a negative review for the hell of it, but no.  This is a good game.  It buys into the first one's hype way too much and often gets carried away with trying to be something other than a good, funny puzzler; but when it's got its eye on the ball there's plenty to enjoy here.

Recommended, but don't come in expecting OMG BEST GAME EVER; that's where it'll disappoint you.
